title: 1. Decide tech stack
body: Evaluate potential programming languages and frameworks (e.g., React+TS, Vanilla JS+Canvas, Python). Consider browser vs desktop. Document final decision.

title: 2. Decide visualisation approach
body: Compare Canvas, SVG, WebGL/Three.js. Select the rendering method for cone animation. Document reasoning.

title: 3. Analyse JSON examples
body: Review all JSON examples from Exercises 01–05. Extract shared structure of phases → nodes → colours → secs. Create draft schema.

title: 4. Define user stories
body: Document key user stories for loading JSON, viewing patterns, adjusting playback, debugging, and layout editing.

title: 5. Define emulator architecture
body: Create diagrams covering: JSON Loader, Parser, Timing Engine, Renderer, UI Controls, and Layout Layer. Document folder structure.

title: 6. Research animation/timing libraries
body: Investigate libraries to support animation loops and timing accuracy. Summarise findings and decisions.

title: 7. Define cone placement strategy
body: JSON does not include positions. Define exercise-driven placement rules, presets, and manual drag-and-drop adjustment.

title: 8. Set up development environment
body: Install tools, create initial project structure, verify Hello World, and document setup steps.

title: 9. Decide hosting/deployment
body: Evaluate GitHub Pages, Vercel, Netlify, Firebase. Choose deployment method. Document steps.

title: 10. Load and parse JSON
body: Allow users to upload/paste JSON. Validate structure. Display parsed data or friendly errors.

title: 11. Render cones using exercise layout
body: Implement layout presets (4-corners, lines, grid). Display cones according to exercise description. Add drag-and-drop.

title: 12. Animate cone colours
body: Implement timing engine. Animate cone colours based on JSON secs and phases. Support multi-phase patterns.

title: 13. Playback controls
body: Add Play, Pause, Restart buttons. Playback must be reliable and easy to understand.

title: 14. Highlight current phase
body: Show current phase number and highlight in UI. Update during playback transitions.

title: 15. Playback speed control
body: Add speed options (0.5x, 1x, 1.5x, 2x). Must not break animation timing.

title: 16. Timeline bar
body: Add a clickable timeline showing phases. Highlight current phase. Jump to any phase.

title: 17. Handle invalid JSON
body: Detect missing fields, invalid colours, unknown node IDs. Show friendly error messages.

title: 18. Layout presets
body: Add common exercise presets: corner setup, parallel lines, rows, grids. Allow manual override.

title: 19. Dark/light mode
body: Add theme toggle. Ensure UI readability.

title: 20. Export/import configuration
body: Allow export of layout + JSON + playback settings. Allow full re-import.

title: 21. Phase summary panel
body: Display summary of each phase: colours used, durations, node activity. Useful for debugging.

title: 22. Deploy public version
body: Deploy emulator to hosting platform. Add link in README. Show version number in UI.

title: 23. Collect feedback and future backlog
body: Run review session. Collect improvement ideas. Create new issues for the next phase.
